main_definition: Video Home System (VHS) refers to a type of cassette format used for recording and playing back analog video, primarily in the form of movies or television shows.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A standard format for home video recordings
meanings_and_examples.example: In the 1980s and 1990s, people would rent VHS tapes of movies from their local video rental stores.
VHS was introduced by JVC in 1976 as a new way to play and record home videos.

alternate_definitions.definition: A term used to refer to the VHS cassette tape itself
alternate_definitions.example: I just bought a new VHS for my old movie collection.

alternate_definitions.definition: An outdated technology that was widely used before DVDs and digital video formats became popular
alternate_definitions.example: My grandparents still have their old VHS player in the attic, but they don't use it anymore.
